text: - I turned 37 this year.
It is not an age anybody applauds for.
(audience laughing and clapping)
Thank you.
Only when you make them feel bad.
(audience laughing)
No it's funny, like good.
I'm getting older, but I'm not old enough
that I can complain about being old,
but I'm not young either.

And I have a lot of friends
in all ranges of ages.
My friends in their 50s, they're like,
you're a kid, shut up, you're fine.
And then my younger friends are like,
how old are you, Scott?

And I'm like 37, and
they're like, that's gross.
(audience laughing)
So I'm just alone in a bubble of 37,
with my own thoughts and my own pains,

and I can't complain to
anybody about my back pain,

because there's someone below
me who thinks I'm disgusting
and there's someone above me
who probably also thinks I'm disgusting.
(audience laughing)
So I'm just alone.

I'm gonna have to put out,
like, a Craig's List ad,

where I'm like, hey,
were you born in 1980?
Do you like earlier Green Day albums?
(audience laughing)

Can I talk to you about my
Irritable Bowel Syndrome?
(audience laughing)

I'll buy the coffee, just
someone sit with me, please.
(audience laughing)
But I know I'm a adult, you know.
I know, I can feel it, I can feel it.

I just can't grow a
mustache, so it's hard.
(audience laughing)

I can't express it to
the world by mustache.

I get so jealous when I
see a guy with a beard,

'cause I'm like, I have
no idea how old he is.
I wish I had that power.
(audience laughing)
You can also, if you have a beard,

you can get fatter and
people don't even care.
They're just like, that's cool.
(audience laughing)

But me, it's all exposed,
and people are like,
are you a little kid?
And I'm like, no, and everybody thinks
I'm younger than I am.

So when I die, it's gonna
be a crazy surprise.
(audience laughing)
They'll be like, I thought he was 24.
No, much older.

Like I was gonna grow a five
o'clock shadow for this show,

but I would have had
to start five days ago.
(audience laughing)
And I just forgot, I was like, ohhh.
We're goin' clean cut.
I have had the same razor for four months.
Actually, that's pretty sweet.
(audience laughing)
I'm saving dollars and dollars every year.
(audience laughing)

But I know I'm an adult, because
certain things strike me.
Like when I'm watching skateboard videos,
I know I'm an adult,

because I relate more with
the security guards now.
(audience laughing)
Like I was watching this cool skate video,
and this kid was doing these cool tricks
at a bank parking lot,

and he was like doing kick
flips and all sorts of stuff.

And all of a sudden this
security guard ran out
and was like, "You gotta leave!"

And his friend swung
his skateboard at him,
and swore at him, and I was like,
you gotta leave that guy alone, you punk!
He makes $11 an hour.
(audience laughing)

There's also some serious
insurance liability issues here
that you don't even understand.
(audience laughing)

And I'm sitting there
thinking, what if he got hurt?
What would his deductible be?
(audience laughing)
How can you sleep at night?
And I just turned it off,
'cause my inner child died in that moment.
(audience laughing)
So I know I'm an adult because of that.

But I'm not the best adult,
'cause I still do stuff
that's kind of irresponsible.
Like the other day I went home,

and I noticed that the sink
was full of dirty dishes,
and instead of cleaning them,

I sprayed them with
Febreze and walked away.
(audience laughing)
- [Narrator] Subscribe to Dry Bar Comedy

for even more of the
world's largest collection
of clean comedy.
